segment.source: Your app needs to include various logos, screenshots, and images.
segment.target: Your app needs to include various logos, screenshots, and images.

segment.source: App screenshots and images
segment.target: App screenshots and images

segment.source: App screenshots and images
segment.target: App screenshots and images

segment.source: Your app needs to include various logos, screenshots, and images.
segment.target: Your app needs to include various logos, screenshots, and images.

segment.source: Some of these are required, and some are optional.
segment.target: Some of these are required, and some are optional.

segment.source: Keep in mind that your images are one of the main ways in which you represent your app.
segment.target: Keep in mind that your images are one of the main ways in which you represent your app.

segment.source: Well-designed images can be a big help in making your app appeal to customers.
segment.target: Well-designed images can be a big help in making your app appeal to customers.

segment.source: During the app submission process, you provide your screenshots and promotional artwork in the Descriptions step.
segment.target: During the app submission process, you provide your screenshots and promotional artwork in the Descriptions step.

segment.source: These images are used to help display your app in the Store.
segment.target: These images are used to help display your app in the Store.

segment.source: The Store also uses your app's tile and other images that you include in your app's package.
segment.target: The Store also uses your app's tile and other images that you include in your app's package.

segment.source: Run the Windows App Certification Kit to determine if you're missing any required images.
segment.target: Run the Windows App Certification Kit to determine if you're missing any required images.

segment.source: Note The way images are used in the Store, on the customer's Start screen, and within the app itself may vary, depending on the customer's operating system and other factors.
segment.target: Note The way images are used in the Store, on the customer's Start screen, and within the app itself may vary, depending on the customer's operating system and other factors.

segment.source: Images provided during the submission process
segment.target: Images provided during the submission process

segment.source: When entering your app's description info, you have the option to provide multiple screenshots (one screenshot is required) and promotional artwork.
segment.target: When entering your app's description info, you have the option to provide multiple screenshots (one screenshot is required) and promotional artwork.

segment.source: These images are not taken from your app's package; you'll need to provide them in the Description step for each of your languages.
segment.target: These images are not taken from your app's package; you'll need to provide them in the Description step for each of your languages.

segment.source: The following table lists the various images you can upload and explains how they are used.
segment.target: The following table lists the various images you can upload and explains how they are used.

segment.source: More details are provided in the sections below.
segment.target: More details are provided in the sections below.

segment.source: Image
segment.target: Image

segment.source: Pixel size
segment.target: Pixel size

segment.source: Usage
segment.target: Usage

segment.source: When to include
segment.target: When to include

segment.source: Desktop screenshots
segment.target: Desktop screenshots

segment.source: 768 x 1366 or larger
segment.target: 768 x 1366 or larger

segment.source: Displayed in your app's Store listing when viewed on a desktop device.
segment.target: Displayed in your app's Store listing when viewed on a desktop device.

segment.source: Recommended for all apps, especially if your app is intended for use on desktop devices.
segment.target: Recommended for all apps, especially if your app is intended for use on desktop devices.

segment.source: (At least one screenshot, either desktop or mobile, is required.)
segment.target: (At least one screenshot, either desktop or mobile, is required.)

segment.source: Mobile screenshots
segment.target: Mobile screenshots

segment.source: Displayed in your app's Store listing when viewed on a mobile device.
segment.target: Displayed in your app's Store listing when viewed on a mobile device.

segment.source: Recommended for all apps, especially if your app is intended for use on mobile devices.
segment.target: Recommended for all apps, especially if your app is intended for use on mobile devices.

segment.source: (At least one screenshot, either desktop or mobile, is required.)
segment.target: (At least one screenshot, either desktop or mobile, is required.)

segment.source: App tile icon
segment.target: App tile icon

segment.source: Displayed as your app's icon in the Store for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier (and, if you only have packages targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier, in the Store on Windows 10)
segment.target: Displayed as your app's icon in the Store for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier (and, if you only have packages targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier, in the Store on Windows 10)

segment.source: Required for proper display in the Store if your app targets Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: Required for proper display in the Store if your app targets Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: Promotional image: Windows 10 Spotlight
segment.target: Promotional image: Windows 10 Spotlight

segment.source: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows 10.
segment.target: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows 10.

segment.source: Recommended for all apps, especially those with UWP packages targeting Windows 10 customers.
segment.target: Recommended for all apps, especially those with UWP packages targeting Windows 10 customers.

segment.source: Promotional images: Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier
segment.target: Promotional images: Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier

segment.source: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.
segment.target: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.

segment.source: Recommended for all apps targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: Recommended for all apps targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: Promotional image: Windows 8.1 and earlier
segment.target: Promotional image: Windows 8.1 and earlier

segment.source: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows 8.1.
segment.target: Used for promotional layouts in the Store on Windows 8.1.

segment.source: Recommended for all apps targeting Windows 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: Recommended for all apps targeting Windows 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: Screenshots
segment.target: Screenshots

segment.source: Screenshots are images of your app that are displayed to your customers in your app's Store listing.
segment.target: Screenshots are images of your app that are displayed to your customers in your app's Store listing.

segment.source: You'll see multiple fields on the Description page where you have the option to provide screenshots for different types of devices.
segment.target: You'll see multiple fields on the Description page where you have the option to provide screenshots for different types of devices.

segment.source: Only one screenshot is required for your submission (though you can provide several; up to 8 mobile screenshots and up to 9 desktop screenshots).
segment.target: Only one screenshot is required for your submission (though you can provide several; up to 8 mobile screenshots and up to 9 desktop screenshots).

segment.source: You are not required to provide separate screenshots for each device type, but we recommend providing screenshots on as many device types as your app supports, so that customers will see images that resemble how the app will look on their device.
segment.target: You are not required to provide separate screenshots for each device type, but we recommend providing screenshots on as many device types as your app supports, so that customers will see images that resemble how the app will look on their device.

segment.source: Note Microsoft Visual Studio provides a tool to help you capture these screenshots.
segment.target: Note Microsoft Visual Studio provides a tool to help you capture these screenshots.

segment.source: Each screenshot must be a .png file in either landscape or portrait orientation, and the file size can't be larger than 2 MB.
segment.target: Each screenshot must be a .png file in either landscape or portrait orientation, and the file size can't be larger than 2 MB.

segment.source: For mobile screenshots, each screenshot must be either 768 x 1280, 720 x 1280, or 480 x 800 pixels.
segment.target: For mobile screenshots, each screenshot must be either 768 x 1280, 720 x 1280, or 480 x 800 pixels.

segment.source: For desktop, each screenshot should be at least 768 x 1366 pixels for best display.
segment.target: For desktop, each screenshot should be at least 768 x 1366 pixels for best display.

segment.source: You can provide a short caption that describes each screenshot in 200 characters or less.
segment.target: You can provide a short caption that describes each screenshot in 200 characters or less.

segment.source: Note If your app supports multiple languages, you'll have a Description page for each language.
segment.target: Note If your app supports multiple languages, you'll have a Description page for each language.

segment.source: You'll need to upload images for each language separately, including captions to use for each language.
segment.target: You'll need to upload images for each language separately, including captions to use for each language.

segment.source: App tile icon
segment.target: App tile icon

segment.source: This is not required for all submissions, but is strongly recommended if your app runs on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: This is not required for all submissions, but is strongly recommended if your app runs on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: The app tile icon is used when displaying your app's listing to customers on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.
segment.target: The app tile icon is used when displaying your app's listing to customers on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier.

segment.source: If you don't provide this image, customers on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier will see a blank icon with your app's listing.
segment.target: If you don't provide this image, customers on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier will see a blank icon with your app's listing.

segment.source: (This also applies to customers on Windows 10, if your app only has packages targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.)
segment.target: (This also applies to customers on Windows 10, if your app only has packages targeting Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.)

segment.source: The app tile icon must be a .png file measuring 300 x 300 pixels.
segment.target: The app tile icon must be a .png file measuring 300 x 300 pixels.

segment.source: Promotional artwork
segment.target: Promotional artwork

segment.source: The Windows Store editorial team uses different images to showcase apps in the Store.
segment.target: The Windows Store editorial team uses different images to showcase apps in the Store.

segment.source: Submitting promotional artwork lets the Windows Store team consider your app in promotional layouts.
segment.target: Submitting promotional artwork lets the Windows Store team consider your app in promotional layouts.

segment.source: Important Providing promotional images for your app doesn't guarantee that your app will be featured, but not providing them means that it can't be considered for all promotional opportunities.
segment.target: Important Providing promotional images for your app doesn't guarantee that your app will be featured, but not providing them means that it can't be considered for all promotional opportunities.

segment.source: (See Making your app easy to promote for more information.)
segment.target: (See Making your app easy to promote for more information.)

segment.source: You may want to submit promotional artwork in different sizes, depending on which OS version(s) your app targets.
segment.target: You may want to submit promotional artwork in different sizes, depending on which OS version(s) your app targets.

segment.source: For all sizes, images must be in .png format.
segment.target: For all sizes, images must be in .png format.

segment.source: Here are some tips to keep in mind when designing your promotional artwork:
segment.target: Here are some tips to keep in mind when designing your promotional artwork:

segment.source: Select dynamic images that relate to the app and drive recognition and differentiation.
segment.target: Select dynamic images that relate to the app and drive recognition and differentiation.

segment.source: Avoid stock photography or generic visuals.
segment.target: Avoid stock photography or generic visuals.

segment.source: Don't include text (aside from your branding).
segment.target: Don't include text (aside from your branding).

segment.source: Minimize empty space in the image.
segment.target: Minimize empty space in the image.

segment.source: Avoid showing your app's UI, and do not use any device-specific imagery.
segment.target: Avoid showing your app's UI, and do not use any device-specific imagery.

segment.source: Avoid political and national themes, flags, or religious symbols.
segment.target: Avoid political and national themes, flags, or religious symbols.

segment.source: Don't include images of insensitive gestures, nudity, gambling, currency, drugs, tobacco, or alcohol.
segment.target: Don't include images of insensitive gestures, nudity, gambling, currency, drugs, tobacco, or alcohol.

segment.source: Don't use weapons pointing at the viewer or excessive violence and gore.
segment.target: Don't use weapons pointing at the viewer or excessive violence and gore.

segment.source: For Windows 10: 2400 x 1200
segment.target: For Windows 10: 2400 x 1200

segment.source: In the Store on Windows 10, the top of the Apps and Games category pages features a rotating Spotlight image to promote content.
segment.target: In the Store on Windows 10, the top of the Apps and Games category pages features a rotating Spotlight image to promote content.

segment.source: To make your app eligible for this Spotlight placement, be sure to submit a 2400 x 1200 image.
segment.target: To make your app eligible for this Spotlight placement, be sure to submit a 2400 x 1200 image.

segment.source: When designing your image, keep in mind that if we use it for the Spotlight, we'll apply a gradient over the bottom third so that we can legibly display marketing text over the image.
segment.target: When designing your image, keep in mind that if we use it for the Spotlight, we'll apply a gradient over the bottom third so that we can legibly display marketing text over the image.

segment.source: Because of this, make sure you avoid placing text and key visual elements in the bottom third.
segment.target: Because of this, make sure you avoid placing text and key visual elements in the bottom third.

segment.source: Additionally, we may crop your image, so place your app's branding and the most important details in the center.
segment.target: Additionally, we may crop your image, so place your app's branding and the most important details in the center.

segment.source: The image below shows the key proportions to keep in mind.
segment.target: The image below shows the key proportions to keep in mind.

segment.source: The "safe zone" in the center will be prominent even if we crop the image.
segment.target: The "safe zone" in the center will be prominent even if we crop the image.

segment.source: The "dynamic text area" is where text and a gradient may appear.
segment.target: The "dynamic text area" is where text and a gradient may appear.

segment.source: guidelines for spotlight image The example below shows a well-designed Spotlight image which keeps these guidelines in mind.
segment.target: guidelines for spotlight image The example below shows a well-designed Spotlight image which keeps these guidelines in mind.

segment.source: (The lines on the image are to illustrate how the artwork fits into the designated areas, and would not be included in the final image.)
segment.target: (The lines on the image are to illustrate how the artwork fits into the designated areas, and would not be included in the final image.)

segment.source: well-designed spotlight image
segment.target: well-designed spotlight image

segment.source: For Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier: 1000 x 800, 358 x 358
segment.target: For Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier: 1000 x 800, 358 x 358

segment.source: In the Store on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, two image sizes can be used in promotional layouts: 1000 x 800 pixels and 358 x 358 pixels.
segment.target: In the Store on Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, two image sizes can be used in promotional layouts: 1000 x 800 pixels and 358 x 358 pixels.

segment.source: If your app runs on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier, we recommend providing images in both of these sizes for promotional consideration.
segment.target: If your app runs on Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier, we recommend providing images in both of these sizes for promotional consideration.

segment.source: Tip Also be sure to provide a 300 x 300 app tile icon image to ensure that your app does not appear in the Store with a blank icon.
segment.target: Tip Also be sure to provide a 300 x 300 app tile icon image to ensure that your app does not appear in the Store with a blank icon.

segment.source: For Windows 8.1 and earlier: 414 x 180
segment.target: For Windows 8.1 and earlier: 414 x 180

segment.source: In the Store on Windows 8.1 and earlier, promotional layouts may use an image in the 414 x 180 pixel size..
segment.target: In the Store on Windows 8.1 and earlier, promotional layouts may use an image in the 414 x 180 pixel size..

segment.source: If your app runs on Windows 8.1 or earlier, we recommend providing an image in this size for promotional consideration.
segment.target: If your app runs on Windows 8.1 or earlier, we recommend providing an image in this size for promotional consideration.
